intro: Onopordum jordanicola, commonly known as Jordanian thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are usually spiny and grayish-green, with a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow to reddish in color. Onopordum jordanicola is often found in rocky habitats and can be a significant component of local flora in its native range.
